derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English, via late Latin and Greek from Aramaic mannā, from Hebrew mān, corresponding to Arabic mann, denoting an exudation of the tamarisk Tamarix mannifera

entry.tran: 天赐之物;(从天而降的)恩赐
entry.def: If you say that something unexpected is manna from heaven, you mean that it is good and happened just at the time that it was needed.

example.ex: Ex-forces personnel could be the manna from heaven employers are seeking...
example.tran: 当过兵的人大概是雇主们寻找的宝贝了。

example.ex: The revealed documents were manna for journalists.
example.tran: 这些披露出的文件让记者们如获至宝。

means.word_mean: 1. hardened sugary exudation of various trees
2. (Old Testament) food that God gave the Israelites during the Exodus
